definition: grand justice/high court justice/supreme court justice
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: It is doubtful that whether the explanation No. 604 of Grand Justice is appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 大法官釋字第604號解釋是否妥適，頗值商榷。

sentences.english: Finally, he called the name of the senator from Kansas.
sentences.chinese: 最後，首席大法官叫到了這位堪薩斯州參議員的名字。

sentences.english: We’re there to provide any assistance the justices might need.
sentences.chinese: 我們的責任是在大法官有需要時提供幫助。

sentences.english: Justice O’Connor herself underwent surgery for breast cancer in 1988.
sentences.chinese: 奧康納大法官在1988年也接受過乳腺癌的手術。

sentences.english: The second chapter is the analysis of "Grand Inquisitor".
sentences.chinese: 第二章是對“宗教大法官”故事的分析。

sentences.english: He came to the bench with no particular ideology.
sentences.chinese: 他就任大法官職務時不帶有特定的意識形態。

sentences.english: The judge was enraged and stroke the table for several times.
sentences.chinese: 大法官被氣得連連拍案。

sentences.english: He said he might support President Obama's nominee for the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 他說他可能支持奧巴馬最高法院大法官的提名人了嗎？

sentences.english: First, I would suggest purchasing an adjustable flat to incline bench and dumbbells.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我建議購買一個可調單位傾斜大法官，並。

sentences.english: They would also allow voters to hold presidents accountable for the quality of justices they nominate.
sentences.chinese: 這亦使選民們能督促總統爲所提名的大法官素質負責。

sentences.english: What disappoints me most is that the five conservative justices are all soi-disant Catholics.
sentences.chinese: 讓我最心寒的是五個保守派大法官都自稱天主教徒。

sentences.english: Other justices have also battled cancer in recent memory.
sentences.chinese: 在最近的記憶裏，其他大法官同樣也在同癌魔做鬥爭。

sentences.english: He has also served as a prime minister and Supreme Court justice.
sentences.chinese: 他也曾當過總理和最高法院的大法官。

sentences.english: In the case of an impeached president, the chief justice of the Supreme Court presides over the trial.
sentences.chinese: 如果彈劾對象爲總統，則由最高法院首席大法官主審。

sentences.english: We do not have an Hispanic.
sentences.chinese: 我們也沒有拉美裔大法官。

sentences.english: Harvey had no very high opinion of him, saying "he writes philosophy like a Lord Chancellor."
sentences.chinese: 哈維不很高看培根，說“他像個大法官似的寫哲學”。

definition: jurist/member of the pre-Han legalist school
Supreme Court of the United States
pinyin: Mei3 guo2 Zui4 gao1 Fa3 yuan4

definition: Judicial Yuan, the high court under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)
